candidates.definition: Movement or flow of liquids and gases through space or systems

positive_examples: The river flows swiftly downstream after the spring thaw
Steam rises from the hot coffee cup into the cool air
Water sprinklers irrigate the garden beds every morning
Oil flows through the pipeline to the refinery
Wind blows across the prairie, bending the tall grass
The irrigation system channels water to the crop fields
negative_examples: The car accelerated down the highway at high speed
She walked quickly through the crowded mall
The elevator moved smoothly between floors
Birds migrate south for the winter months
The train pulled into the station right on schedule
He threw the ball across the field to his teammate
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: SolidMotion, AnimalMotion, VehicleMotion, BodyMovement

candidates.definition: Movement that involves a specific spatial direction or change in orientation

positive_examples: The ball rolled down the hill gathering speed
She turned left at the intersection
The elevator climbed to the fifteenth floor
He reversed the car out of the driveway
The arrow pointed upward toward the sky
The river flows northward through the valley
negative_examples: The engine vibrated but remained stationary
She walked at a steady pace for an hour
The wheel spun rapidly in place
The pendulum oscillated back and forth
He moved quickly through the crowd
The machine operated continuously all day
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: MotionSpeed, MotionContinuous, MotionOscillating, MotionRotational

candidates.definition: Motion that involves applying physical force or pressure to move, shape, or position objects

positive_examples: She pulled the heavy suitcase across the airport floor
He pushed the stalled car to the side of the road
The mechanic compressed the spring to fit it into place
The athlete stretched the resistance band during warm-up
Workers pushed and pulled the piano up the stairs
The machine compresses aluminum cans for recycling
negative_examples: The bird flew gracefully across the sky
Water flowed gently down the stream
The dancer moved elegantly across the stage
The train accelerated smoothly out of the station
She walked quietly through the library
The ball rolled down the hill on its own
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: FlowMotion, RotationalMotion, LinearMovement, RandomMotion

candidates.definition: Physical movement involving the operation or manipulation of mechanical parts, openings, or rotating elements

positive_examples: She turned the doorknob and pushed the heavy wooden door open
The mechanic rotated the wrench to tighten the bolt
He slammed the car trunk shut with a loud bang
The fan blades spun rapidly to cool the overheated engine
She twisted the cap off the bottle and heard it pop
The garage door slowly rolled up on its tracks
negative_examples: The dancer gracefully moved across the stage
Water flowed downstream through the rocky canyon
The bird soared high above the treetops
She walked quickly down the busy sidewalk
The clouds drifted lazily across the blue sky
His heart rate increased as he ran up the hill
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BiologicalMovement, FluidMotion, LinearTravel, OscillatingMotion

candidates.definition: Mechanical motion and processes that occur within internal combustion engines during operation

positive_examples: The engine cranked to life on the cold morning
During the compression stroke, the piston moved upward
Exhaust gases were expelled from the cylinder
The intake valve opened to draw in the fuel mixture
The combustion cycle pushed the piston downward with force
The two-stroke engine completed its transfer phase
negative_examples: The car accelerated down the highway
The wheels rotated as the vehicle moved forward
The transmission shifted into higher gear
The brake pedal was pressed to stop the car
The steering wheel turned left at the intersection
The suspension absorbed the road bumps
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: VehicleMotion, RotationalMotion, LinearMotion, FluidMotion, OscillatoryMotion
